column4: Median relative astrometric measurement error on 5/20/200 arcminute scales
Fraction of sources excceding an outlier limit
RMS difference/outlier limit between separations in r-band and any other filter
RMS difference between separations measured in the r-band and those measured in any other filter.
The RMS photometric repeatability of bright non-saturated unresolved point sources in the uzy/gri filters
Repeatability outlier limit for isolated bright non-saturated point sources in the uzy/gri filters.

RMS width of internal photometric
zero-point across the sky
The zero point error outlier limit.
Accuracy of absolute band-to-band color zero-point for all colors constructed from any filter pair
Accuracy of the transformation of the internal LSST photometry to a physical scale (e.g. AB mag)

The maximum fraction of isolated nonsaturated point source measurements
exceeding the outlier limit.
Fraction of zeropoint errors that can exceed the zero point error outlier limit

Maximum full-survey median for
residual ellipticity correlations at
scales less than or equal to 1/5 arcmin.

Per-image limit on the median residual
ellipticity correlations at scales less
than 5 arcmin (and greater than 5 arcmin).

Maximum fraction of visit images that
may exceed the TE3 or TE4 limits.
The maximum fraction of pixels scientifically unusable per sensor out
The maximum allowable fraction of sensors with PixFrac scientifically unusable pixels.
The maximum error in the precision of the sky brightness determination
Percentage of image area that can have ghosts with surface brightness gradient amplitude of more than 1/3 of the sky noise over 1 arcsec.
The maximum local significance integrated over the PSF of imperfect crosstalk corrections.

column2: The below reqirements are a little higher level, and will not be run in every faro run, but are good to know about I think, and are likely to still be implimented in Faro

column4: False detection fraction on deep coadds due to unremoved and instrumental artifacts will be < 0.1% of sources

The Object catalog shall include shape measurements that permit the
recovery of constant applied shears between 0.01 and 0.05 from an ensemble of isolated
galaxies, with a multiplicative bias less than 0.001 and additive biases less than 0.0001.
The Observatory shall be capable of measuring properties of overlapping (blended) objects.

The object catalog completeness and reliability shall be determined by the data management system for a variety of astrophysical objects to be specified by the LSST Project Science Team by the start of science validation activities at the end of commissioning. This is likely to use both refcats and synthetic injection.
